This page contains a list of test generators:
http://www.junit.org/news/extension/testcase_generation/index.htm

   BTW: There doesn't appear to be a link to that page anywhere,
   which makes it hard to find. You have to click on a link that goes
   to one of the entries on that page.

I'd like to know what people think of them, and get their rating/review.

For example:

    JUnitDoclet
        Sets up one test fixture per class, and one test for each method

        in the class. Comments identify areas where code can be added,
        so the generator can be run repeatly without affecting existing
tests.

        Strength: Good for creating a "complete coverage" framework.
                       Allows regenerating tests.
        Weakness: Not good for "behavior-oriented" testing.
                       You can wind up with a lot of empty tests.

Motivation:
I'm pretty well sold that what I really need is behavior-oriented
testing,
and I'm wondering whether I should simply create some template classes
in my idioms library that I can copy to create a new test, or whether
one of the other generators would offer some useful assistance in that
task.
